blotteth out thy transgressions. The Lord reminds his people that he is capable of forgiving and forgetting their sins (6:7; 55:6-7). This beautiful promise also applies to us.

will not remember thy sins. A latter-day revelation reads similarly, "Behold, he who has repented of his sins, the same is forgiven, and I, the Lord, remember them no more" (D&C 58:42). Isa. 43:25-26 corresponds with Isa. 1:18.

for mine own sake. The Lord is glorified by the purification and salvation of his people. Note in Moses 1:39 the Lord's words: "This is my work and my glory—to bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man" (emphasis added). Note also Isa. 48:11, in which the words "For mine own sake" are found twice.
